data.title: The Throne of Saturn by S. Fowler Wright: Very Good (1949)
data.meta_description: 1st Edition - Arkham House, Sauk City - 1949 - Condition: Very Good - Very Good - Sauk City: Arkham House, 1949. First Edition. Octavo; viii, 186pp. 3062 copies printed (3000 stated on colophon at back). Original dust jacket with $3.00 price intact; book in Holliston Black Novelex cloth with gilt lettering to spine. Jacket a bit scuffed along folds and at spine ends, but crisp with no chips or tears. Boards are square, with some rubbing and exposure along top edge, nudging to spine ends, and some very light abrasions at bottom back. Glue toning along gutter of last page and tipped-in colophon, with a patch of light smudging on final page but all text legible. Binding is sound and pages unmarked. Collection of thematically-linked short science fiction stories, but the author of The World Below and Deluge. [Joshi 42]. - The Throne of Saturn
data.text:
About this Item

Sauk City: Arkham House, 1949. First Edition. Octavo; viii, 186pp. 3062 copies printed (3000 stated on colophon at back). Original dust jacket with $3.00 price intact; book in Holliston Black Novelex cloth with gilt lettering to spine. Jacket a bit scuffed along folds and at spine ends, but crisp with no chips or tears. Boards are square, with some rubbing and exposure along top edge, nudging to spine ends, and some very light abrasions at bottom back. Glue toning along gutter of last page and tipped-in colophon, with a patch of light smudging on final page but all text legible. Binding is sound and pages unmarked. Collection of thematically-linked short science fiction stories, but the author of The World Below and Deluge. [Joshi 42]. Seller Inventory # 10084

Contact seller

Report this item

We are a neighborhood independent bookstore in Washington, D.C.'s Capitol Hill neighborhood, across from Eastern Market.

Visit Seller's Storefront

Association Member Members of these associations are committed to maintaining the highest standards. They vouch for the authenticity of all items offered for sale. They provide expert and detailed descriptions, disclose all significant defects and/or restorations, provide clear and accurate pricing, and operate with fairness and honesty during the purchase experience.

Seller's business information

Hecatomb Holdings, LLC

657 C Street, SE, Washington, DC, 20003, U.S.A.

Terms of Sale:

We guarantee the condition of every book as it's described on the Abebooks web sites. If

you're dissatisfied with your purchase (Incorrect Book/Not as Described/Damaged) or if the

order hasn't arrived, you're eligible for a refund within 30 days of the estimated delivery

date. If you've changed your mind about a book that you've ordered, please use the Ask

bookseller a question link to contact us and we'll respond within 2 business days.

Shipping Terms:

Orders generally ship via USPS within 1-2 business days in new, sturdy boxes.

For International orders: the default average shipping weight on AbeBooks is based upon a 2.2 lb (1 kg) package, so heavier books or sets will often require extra postage. Feel free to contact us for estimates. Customs declarations will clssify the contents as Merchandise, described as "Book (used)" and valued at the book's purchase price (sans shipping).
